availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: John Mason Doyle (Bath County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier)

body.p: Bath County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier. Kentucky native. Son of John Doyle and Malinda Doyle. Married to Livonia Ann Doyle. Father of Mary Doyle, William Doyle, Rosella Doyle, and Ida H. Doyle. Farmer in Bath County, Kentucky, in 1860. Served in the 10th Kentucky Volunteer Cavalry Regiment (U.S.A.) as a private from September 9, 1862, to September 17, 1863.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Bath County, District 1, p. 93B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Bath County, p. 119.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Bath County, Bethel, p. 18A.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 1, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 254.
